page.title: 03Wychwood Lodge, Ramsden
page.content: The house is part 17th century and part 20th century. The owners must be very rich. The out buildings and barns are now being turned into a playroom, recreation room and stores, using Cotswold stone and Stonesfield Slate. All new windows and doors are made from solid oak. The existing house has been updated and now consists of four bedrooms, four bath- rooms, study reception, large lounge, dining room, kitchen and entrance hall. It is completly centrally heated but has fire places. The house stands in about 20 acres of of land and has a swimming pool and tennis court. It cost #300 000 to buy and another #300 000 to modernize. It is only the weekend cottage of a commodity buyer.
